thread.title: Deposit/Hancock battle-tested entering Section IV playoffs
thread.title_full: Deposit/Hancock battle-tested entering Section IV playoffs

title: Deposit/Hancock battle-tested entering Section IV playoffs
text:
Deposit/Hancock battle-tested entering Section IV playoffs 
By Travis Eldridge October 22, 2015 Updated Oct 23, 2015 at 12:23 AM EDT 
Deposit, NY (WBNG Binghamton) Tioga and Deposit/Hancock are the top two seeds in the Section IV Class D playoffs and the two highest ranked Section IV teams in the Class D state rankings. But they share another fact. The Tigers are actually the last team to beat the Eagles. 
That happened in the quarterfinal round of last year's playoffs. 
Since that point, Deposit/Hancock has won eight straight games, and this year grabbed the two seed instead of the seven seed in the playoff bracket. 
The team is the only undefeated Class D team left in Section IV. 
Now, the Eagles are hoping to rely on the experience of being in the playoffs last year, but this time change the outcome against seventh-seed Groton on Friday night. 
"We actually played better than we thought we were going to against Tioga last year and having everybody back except for two guys helps us," said head coach Jeremiah Johnson. "They're experienced, they're ready to go and I think being battle tested all year. You know, we played Walton and Greene and they're pretty tough teams. That is going to help us in the playoffs, I think." 
"Playoffs is a whole new world, you've got a lot more pressure," added senior Ronnie Ballard. "It's crazy." 
The craziness begins in Hancock on Friday night at 7 p.m. as the Eagles face Groton. To submit a comment on this article, your email address is required. We respect your privacy and your email will not be visible to others nor will it be added to any email lists. Most Viewed
